page.title: 10DALEFORD QUARRY,WHITEGATE
page.content:
This particular site was chosen because there is much sand and it is mainly poor farmland. The land is not suitable for farming because the sand takes all the moisture out of the ground. The quarry has been working for 25-30 years. It is not likely to expand a great deal, though extraction is starting on a near-by hill.
The quarry is in the green belt area and the quality of sand varies greatly. The limit of extraction in depth is the water table: this is where the sand becomes rather like clay. The sand is extracted by J.C.B. mechanical machines that dig the sand. About 75 000 tonnes of sand are quarried annually.
